title: 2  MAPS tool user guide
text:
2.1 About this guide
This guide is intended to provide additional information on the data and visualisations in the MAPS tool. It can be read in sequence, or users can use the navigation panel on the LEFT to select the section and functionality they are interested in.
This guide precedes the completion of tool functionality, as part of our iterative release practice, and is being updated as features are released. Where text is yet to be released, or sections relate to features still under development, this is indicated by the following symbol:
.
Complementary guides are provided for educational users [] and web developers [].
Further information on the project and project team which created the MAPS tool can be found at the project website https://micronutrient.support/. A summary of our co-design process, implemented to design and test the MAPS tool, can be found at

title: References
text:
Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput.
J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: MAPS tool user guide
text:
1 About this guide
This guide is intended to provide additional information on the data and visualisations in the MAPS tool. It can be read in sequence, or users can use the navigation panels to directly select the section and functionality they are interested in.
This guide precedes the completion of tool functionality, as part of our iterative release practice, and is being updated as features are released. Where text is yet to be released, or sections relate to features still under development, this is indicated by the following symbol: .
Complementary guides are provided for educational users [] and web developers [].
Further information on the project and project team which created the MAPS tool can be found at the project website https://micronutrient.support/. A summary of our co-design process, implemented to design and test the MAPS tool, can be found at [].

title: 1  MAPS tool user guide

1.2 Section 1
New text for the manual

title: 2  MAPS tool user guide
section: 2.2 Accessing, and returning to, the MAPS tool
text:
2.2 Accessing, and returning to, the MAPS tool
The MAPS tool can be accessed directly from https://maps.micronutrient.support/ or https://maps.micronutrient.support/maps-tool, and via our shortcut https://www.maps.africa/. All three links lead to exactly the same version of the tool.
The MAPS tool has been optimised for screen sizes typically found with desktop and laptop devices, rather than smaller mobile devices. Using smaller devices is possible, but will not provide the intended appearance of the interfaces. The tool will work in widely used commercial operating systems and web browsers (as at 2024).
Access is free of charge and does not require users to log-in. Users of the full scope of functionality, i.e. the cost & effectiveness modelling, and/or bring-your-own data [], may prefer to create a user account in order to save for a later date their own input data and models.

The MAPS tool has been optimised for screen sizes typically found with desktop and laptop devices, rather than smaller mobile devices. Using smaller devices is possible, but will not provide the intended appearance of the interfaces. The tool will work in widely used commercial operating systems and web browsers (as at 2024).
Access is free of charge and does not require users to log-in. Users of the full scope of functionality, i.e. the cost & effectiveness modelling, and/or bring-your-own data [], may prefer to create a user account in order to save for a later date their own input data and models.

title: 4  Glossary for this guide
text:
A MAPS tool feature, or linked guide/documentation, which is not yet available. This symbol will be removed and text/links inserted as features and resources become available.
MAPS Micronutrient Action Policy Support
LSFF Large-scale food fortification
